message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms of symmetric bilateral joint pain and recent low-grade fever suggest Parvovirus. Reactive arthritis typically presents with asymmetric joint pain and Rheumatoid arthritis is a chronic condition that doesn’t go away on its own after 2 weeks. Transient synovitis is typically seen in children and is self-limiting within a few days.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms of symmetric bilateral joint pain, recent low-grade fever, and improvement of symptoms without treatment all suggest Parvovirus, also known as fifth disease. Reactive arthritis may also have joint pain, but it usually occurs after an infection, which is not mentioned in the patient's history. Rheumatoid arthritis has a more chronic course and is not likely to resolve without intervention. Transient synovitis typically occurs in children and is localized to one joint.

Reactive arthritis also presents with joint pain but it usually occurs after a bacterial infection. Rheumatoid arthritis is a chronic condition and transient synovitis typically presents with joint pain and swelling in one joint.

Reactive arthritis and rheumatoid arthritis generally require longer periods of treatment and can lead to chronic disease. Transient synovitis generally affects a single joint and resolves within a few days.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symmetric joint pain, low-grade fever, and improvement of symptoms suggest infectious arthropathy. Among the options, only Parvovirus is known to cause joint pain that resolves on its own. Reactive arthritis may also occur after infection, but it usually lasts longer than 2 weeks. Rheumatoid arthritis is a chronic condition, and transient synovitis is usually seen in children.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The joint pain is symmetric and improves throughout the day, which suggests a viral arthritis like Parvovirus. The recent low-grade fever with malaise also supports this diagnosis. Reactive arthritis can be caused by infections, but the joint pain tends to be asymmetric and can last for months. Rheumatoid arthritis usually presents with morning stiffness lasting more than an hour and can cause joint deformities over time. Transient synovitis typically occurs in children and is characterized by acute onset of hip pain and limping.

Reactive arthritis would be associated with a recent infection, but the patient's sexual activity makes an STI a possible trigger. Rheumatoid arthritis has a more chronic and progressive course, while transient synovitis typically occurs in children and manifests as hip pain rather than polyarticular joint pain.

Reactive arthritis may occur after a bacterial infection, and Rheumatoid arthritis is a chronic autoimmune condition. Transient synovitis is usually seen in children and involves the hip joint.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest a viral infection and the joint pain is likely due to parvovirus, also known as fifth disease. Reactive arthritis is also a possibility, but is less likely given the patient’s lack of recent gastrointestinal or genitourinary infection. Rheumatoid arthritis is less likely given the absence of joint swelling and prolonged symptoms. Transient synovitis generally occurs in children and is characterized by sudden onset of hip pain and limp, which is not consistent with this patient’s presentation.
